Class Deck

  • java.lang.Object
    • Deck

  • public class Deck
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to hold values and perform functions like a real deck of cards
    Author:
    WinstanleyA

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Deck()
      Default constructor to make a full sorted deck
      Deck(boolean sort)
      creates a deck with either sorted or unsorted contents
      Deck(int cph)
      returns a "deck" that represents a hand of cards with limited functionality

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Deck[] deal(int hands, int cph)
      Deals cards out to hands with the right number of cards in each hand
      boolean equals(Deck other)
      returns a boolean to show whether or not decks match
      void fill(boolean sort)
      this method fills an otherwise empty deck either sorted or unsorted based on the parameter
      Card[] getCards()
      returns the field array cards
      int getNumCardsPerSuit()
      returns the field numCardsPerSuit
      int getNumSuits()
      returns the field numSuits
      int getTopCard()
      returns the field topCard
      void mergeSort()
      I want it to look better from the main so I made the other methods private and this one without parameters and public, for purely aesthetic reasons
      Card pick()
      returns a card randomly picked from the deck
      void selectSort()
      Sorts the deck based on the selection sort algorithm
      void shuffle()
      Shuffles all the Cards in cards
      java.lang.String toString()
      returns a string representation on the object

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Deck other)
        returns a boolean to show whether or not decks match
        Parameters:
        other - is the other Deck you want to compare
        Returns:
        boolean true if the decks match false otherwise

      • deal

        public Deck[] deal(int hands,
          int cph)
        Deals cards out to hands with the right number of cards in each hand
        Parameters:
        hands - is the number of hands to deal
        cph - is the cards per hand
        Returns:
        out an array of decks all containing the same number of Cards

      • pick

        public Card pick()
        returns a card randomly picked from the deck
        Returns:

      • mergeSort

        public void mergeSort()
        I want it to look better from the main so I made the other methods private and this one without parameters and public, for purely aesthetic reasons
